title: Platform Engineer
description:
About Us

We're an award-winning innovative tech consultancy - a team of creative problem solvers. Since 1993 we've been finding better, more sustainable ways to solve complex technology problems for some of the world's leading organisations and delivered solutions that millions of people use every day.

In the last 30 years we won several awards, including a prestigious Queen's Award for Enterprise in the Innovation category for our Enterprise Agile delivery approach.

Operating from 26 locations across the world, we bring together teams of creative experts with diverse backgrounds and experiences, who enjoy working and learning in our collaborative and open culture and are committed to world-class delivery.

We want to continue to grow our team with people just like you!

Our platform engineers design, build and maintain the delivery infrastructure, systems and processes underpinning technology transformation engagements and lead the adoption of modern platforms and ways of working.

About the Role

We're looking for hands-on platform engineers with deep understanding of the Azure ecosystem to join delivery teams working on some of the most exciting digital programmes around, with clients in a range of industries.

As an Azure expert, you'll work in small product teams alongside developers, architects, designers, analysts and product owners to deliver automation, tooling and cloud infrastructure.

We encourage continuous learning, so as well as the opportunity to work with some of the brightest and best in the industry, and evaluate the latest technologies, we'll reward you for obtaining Azure certifications.

About You

You'll have the expertise and confidence to lead the definition and support of the Azure delivery platform in complex engagements, typically working in multi-disciplinary teams on client site. You'll have:

  • Commercial experience across designing, deploying and managing cloud environments in Azure.
  • Experience of containers and container orchestration using Docker, Kubernetes, and AKS.
  • Experience with infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform, ARM Templates, Helm, or Pulumi.
  • Experience of pipeline build/deploy tools such as Azure DevOps, TFS, or Jenkins.
  • In-depth automation and scripting using tools such as PowerShell, AZ CLI, Python, Bash, Ruby, or Groovy.
  • Detailed knowledge of configuration management technologies like DSC, Puppet, Chef, SaltStack, or Ansible.
  • Thorough knowledge of logging and monitoring tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, Azure Monitor, Azure Log Analytics, Azure App Insights, New Relic, or Datadog.
  • Knowledge of cloud platform design patterns and best practices.
  • Knowledge of common database and caching technologies, such as Azure SQL, CosmosDB, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, MySQL/MariaDB, Memcache, or Redis.
  • Some knowledge of common programming languages used in modern web application development, such as C#, JavaScript, TypeScript, Java, Go, or PHP.
  • Exposure to iterative/agile development methodologies and experience of enabling team delivery through technology.
  • As a bonus, experience of other cloud platforms and technologies.

If you don't feel you match with all the above, we're still interested! We have opportunities across a wide range of skill sets and levels in tech. More than anything, we're excited about people who love technology and learning how to make it work. We'd really like to hear from you, and hopefully find you your dream job at BJSS.

Some of the Perks

  • Flexible benefits allowance – you choose how to spend your allowance (additional pension contributions, healthcare, dental and more)
  • Industry leading health and wellbeing plan - we partner with several wellbeing support functions to cater to each individual's need, including 24/7 GP services, mental health support, and other
  • Life Assurance (4 x annual salary)
  • 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
  • Hybrid working - Our roles are not fully remote as we take pride in the tight knit communities we have created at our local offices. But we offer plenty of flexibility and you can split your time between the office, client site and WFH
  • Discounts – we have preferred rates from dozens of retail, lifestyle, and utility brands
  • An industry-leading referral scheme with no limits on the number of referrals
  • Flexible holiday buy/sell option
  • Electric vehicle scheme
  • Training opportunities and incentives – we support professional certifications across engineering and non-engineering roles, including unlimited access to O'Reilly
  • Giving back – the ability to get involved nationally and regionally with partnerships to get people from diverse backgrounds into tech
  • You will become part of a squad with people from different areas within the business who will help you grow at BJSS
  • We have a busy social calendar that you can chose to join– quarterly town halls/squad nights out/weekends away with families included/office get togethers
  • GymFlex gym membership programme

title: Back End Developer
description:
Your attitude, potential and passion is what matters. Work inside a talented development team, you will be expected to produce well tested code to a tight acceptance criteria.

Viva IT is an innovative and exciting fintech. We specialise in creating mobile app and web-based financial software. Although we have a fully remote workforce, we are centred in the East Midlands, UK.

We believe there are just a few simple things needed to create great software: state of the art technology, a continuously delivering pipeline of code, a purpose, a relaxed working environment, and most importantly a like minded team of people.

We take an hybrid-agile approach to product development, forgoing the traditional vertical structure of management, meaning that even our newest developers will be given opportunities and encouraged to lead and learn.

We're looking for software engineers who share our passion for code. We're primarily a PHP team, but we're strong believers that language doesn't matter - the kind of software engineer we're looking for will be able to create magic, regardless of the language however previous experience in our tools will be a bonus.

We use an array of tools, technologies and frameworks including:

  • PHP 8.2
  • Symfony LTS releases including: 5.4 and 6.4
  • MySQL
  • React
  • Javascript
  • PHPUnit
  • Git & GitHub
  • YouTrack
  • TeamCity
  • PHPStorm

Exposure to these tools is always favourable, but as an engineer we're sure you'll relish the opportunity to learn new technology and use new tools. We release multiple times a day through a fully automated release pipeline, this is development in the fast lane and there is no room to dawdle.

Ultimately, we want people who have a compulsion to solve problems, that thrive at being challenged, crave knowledge, aspire to be the best, a desire to deliver value, and most of all, people who have a real passion for the work. People just like us.

Requirements

  • A BSc/MSc in a relevant field such as computer science, software engineering, etc.
  • or 2 years of relevant industry experience in commercial software development.

Our ideal candidate would have:

  • 2 years of commercial Programming experience, ideally in PHP.
  • Great understanding of object-oriented design and patterns.
  • First-hand experience in creating database driven applications.
  • Extensive experience in version control systems, particularly Git.
  • A good understanding of web application security.
  • A good understanding of software testing.
  • A passion for open-source technology.

What is the work like?

For an insight into what is like working as a software developer at Viva IT, take a look at some blogs from other developers:

  • A year with Viva IT by Sophie
  • A month with Viva IT by Joe
  • Four years with Viva IT by Kane
  • Things I wish I'd known before starting at Viva IT by Leighton

Salary

Starting salary is negotiated based on previous experience with annual reviews. However indicative bands are below, depending on relevant acedemic background and commercial experience.

  • Graduate without commercial experience (BSc Hons): £25k
  • Graduate with 2y commercial experience: £25k-35k
  • 2-4y relevant experience: £35k-48k
  • 5y+ relevant experience: £48k+

We consider all experience and acedemic achievements.

Remote Work

The COVID-19 lockdowns accelerated our plans to become a remote-first company. Our team has transitioned fully to fully remote and there are no plans to return to the office. We heavily use remote collaboration tools. Although the path to remote-first includes an international team and no restrictions on working times, we're not quite ready for this yet.

It is critical that:

  • You have a quiet and comfortable location where you can work from home, equipment can be provided.
  • You can travel occasionally (2-4 times a year) to a location in the East Midlands, UK.
  • You can work typical office times 09:00 to 17:30 (we've not transitioned to full flexible working)
  • Must be based in the UK permanently.

Visa/Sponsorships

We are not licensed to sponsor a visa and we have no immediate plans to register for a license.

Eligibility to work in the UK

Please ensure that you are eligible to work in the United Kingdom before you apply without a time limited visa.

Recruiters

We do not work with recruiters in any capacity. Please do not call us or send unsolicited CV's.

Location

Although we have a remote team, we do occasionally meet up for social or business critical kick-off meetings. It is important that you can occasionally travel to these venues which will be based around the East Midlands.

Job Directory Websites

If you came to this page via another recruitment website or job directory, please be advised that if you submit your information through this job directory channel, you might not get a response.

Applying

If you're interested, please send us anything you'd like us to take a look at such as your CV, cover letter, links to your personal website, portfolios or GitHub to careers@vivait.co.uk.

Grow with us. Help us to succeed, and we'll help you to succeed.

If you have a further enquiry that might not be answered on this page, or you would like to apply for a role on our careers page, it is crucial that you contact us via our email address. We will not be able to help via the telephone. Any messages sent to our careers email address will be picked up by a member of our team.

title: .NET Developer
description:

THE IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL:

Alternatively, if you are unavailable, would you be open to exploring 250* pounds referral fee for 10 minutes' work? I will offer you 250 pounds worth of shopping vouchers of your choice upon successful placement of that individual. Do you know good VB.Net Software Developer(s)?

title: Front End Developer
description:
The role will traverse the entire software delivery lifecycle. We are looking for candidates with not only great technical abilities, but commercial awareness and communication skills as there will be significant exposure to internal business teams and product owners.

The ideal candidate will be an exceptionally talented Front-end/Javascript Developer who is passionate about producing solutions of the highest possible standard and working on bleeding edge products with a team of like-minded peers.

Desirable Skills

title: Software Engineer
description:
This is an exciting opportunity to join an award winning, well-established and growing software company, based in Nottingham City Centre. Providing pioneering technology, you’ll contribute to a range of innovative and high-profile projects. The role covers all aspects of software production, but the focus is on the development of web applications.


Technologies used include:


  • ASP.NET MVC with C# 6 & 7 (Web API, RESTful)
  • SQL Server 2016 (complex data transformations, high performance querying)
  • Reactive, modern designs (Bootstrap, SVG, Highcharts, D3.js)
  • Extensive JavaScript use (MVVM via Knockout.js, SPA via Durandal)
  • Distributed architecture (MassTransit, RabbitMQ)

Requirements:


We’re looking for capable, highly literate and personable people with web application development experience with the Microsoft development stack, particularly C#, although other relevant skills and experience will be considered.


Just as importantly, we need you to be able to analyse problems, produce effective documentation and see projects through to fruition. We want you to use your skills and experience to help shape the direction of products you are working on.


In particular, the experience we’re looking for is in:


  • Implementing web applications using MVC/MVVM patterns
  • MS SQL Server, including optimised stored procedures, performance analysis, optimisation and tuning
  • JavaScript frameworks, particularly Knockout.js
  • Rich Single Page Application-style user interfaces


Any of the following experience would be beneficial:


  • High Availability (HA) & Disaster Recovery (DR)
  • Statistical calculations and modelling
  • Developing software for healthcare


Remuneration and Benefits:


  • £35,000 - £45,000 + Benefits
  • Friendly, relaxed environment
  • Flexible working conditions
  • Ongoing professional development and training tailored to you


Location:


Nottingham City Centre


If you think you’ve got what it takes, we’d love to hear from you!

description:

This role is purely a development position (so no expectations of team leadership etc. in the short-medium term). You will need to understand data, and the challenges of managing it, ideally on a large scale.


Just as importantly, you will need to be able to analyse problems, produce effective documentation and see projects through to fruition. They will want you to use your skills and experience to help shape the direction of products you are working on.

  • ASP.NET MVC with C# 6 & 7 (Web API, Entity Framework, RESTful)

  • Front-End frameworks, including Bootstrap & LESS, and package management tools like gulp & bower

You will be organised, highly literate and able to integrate quickly into the existing team. You will be confident enough to talk about new ideas you have and explain clearly how they work and how they can improve what you are working on.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Our talented people are creating the technology of the future.

Tracsis’ purpose is to empower the world to move freely, safely and sustainably. Our approach focuses on combining leading edge software and hardware knowledge, data capture, analytics and industry expertise to generate insights and fast-to-market products and services.

MPEC Technology, who are part of the Tracsis group, is the leading supplier of condition monitoring hardware and software to the UK railway and has helped make Britain’s railways safer and more reliable. We get to work with technology as old as mechanical signalling, right through to the latest artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms.

What you will do..

You will be joining our growing team of enterprise software engineers to deliver the Centrix web application which receives, analyses and presents data from our IOT devices. This platform processes billions of data events from across the UK and worldwide; providing near real-time monitoring and fault alerting for a variety of railway assets.

As a member of the enterprise development team, you will be responsible for designing and implementing new features, collaborating as part of an agile team.

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or similar field.
  • Excellent (English) written and verbal communication skills.
  • Object-Oriented Development e.g. JAVA.

Desirable Skills. You don't need to tick every box!

  • Knowledge of Relational Databases, e.g. SQL.
  • Familiarity with Spring Framework and/or Spring Boot.
  • Web concepts such as HTTP, REST, JSON.
  • Experience with frontend development
  • Frontend stack e.g. HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
  • Frontend JavaScript framework(s) e.g. Angular, React etc.
  • Understanding of version control systems e.g. Git.

Tech Stack

  • Java
  • Spring Boot Framework
  • SQL / relational database
  • Hibernate
  • Typescript / Javascript
  • AngularJS Framework
  • HTML + CSS / LESS
  • Git
  • AWS
  • CI/CD Tools

What we will offer you..

  • Flexible working hours
  • Hybrid/ remote working options
  • Generous group bonus scheme.
  • 25 days leave, plus bank holidays (extendable through long term service scheme).
  • Discounted commuter rail travel.
  • Discounted leisure rail travel for you and a partner.
  • Complimentary lunch provided every day (when working in the office)
  • Company cycle scheme.
  • BUPA medical health care from day 1


We are a 2024 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

description:

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Senior Java/JEE Developer
Responsibilities & Deliverables:
  • Design, develop and implement mission critical systems.
  • Devise high-level technical architecture for the epics.
  • Review design suggestions and ensure the delivered code fulfils the expected level of quality.
  • Implementation and enhancement of existing Java J2EE application including web-front-end.
  • Participate in the conception, design and implementation of modern Web-applications for financial
messaging.
  • Liaise with the business to capture and specify epics and break them down into user stories.
  • Be an active team player in an agile development environment.
What will work well with our team?
  • We take a pragmatic approach to our work in an environment that blends fun with professionalism.
  • Good communication skills (English language skills) and easy going manner.
  • Amenable character with a good attitude.
  • Comfortable working under pressure to firm deadlines in an agile and lean way.
  • Working with Scrum in a multiple scrum team environment.
  • Passion to produce great quality software for our customers.
  • Understanding of FinTech environment/software products.
Skills & Requirements
  • Education to degree level in Computer Science or other technical related fields.
  • The ideal candidate should typically have 7+ years’ professional experience in software development,
or equivalent capabilities.
  • Hands-on Enterprise level system development using Core Java (up to Java 8) and JEE (JBoss
Wildfly/EAP 7, Tomcat) or similar app servers.
  • Advanced experience of Maven, Spring, Hibernate/JPA, Junit, and Messaging Systems such as MQ,
JMS, HornetQ.
  • At least basic database knowledge of Oracle ( INGRES a bonus) – SQL.
  • Ability to analyse large amount of data to optimize existing or find new algorithms (data mining).
  • Ability to manage optimization and false positive reduction by statistical learning or machine learning.
  • Ideal to have specialist skills such as Artifactory/Jenkins administration, CD/CI, SOLR/Lucene
indexing, message parsing technology Antlr/Google protocol buffers, UI/Javascript/CSS, ZKoss,
AngularJS frameworks and QA.
  • Ideal to have experience with payment systems such as SIC/euroSIC, SECOM, SEPA, FED/CHIPS,
SWIFT or banking/financial services domain experience.
  • Ideal to have some or all of: ISGi, Cloud and Ingres/Oracle experience.

title: Front End Developer
description:
Cordius are currently looking for a skilled developer to join the UK's largest tachograph analysis provider.
As part of the software development team, you will contribute to the enhancement of existing products and the creation of new ones. The position requires web front-end and server-side expertise. The team is small and dynamic, employing contemporary web design techniques and technologies effectively. The role requires gaining knowledge of the business domain in order to contribute to the analysis of features and, as needed, to the overall software design.
Key Responsibilities
  • Deliver high quality software in acceptable timescales
  • To suggest estimates of expected time to complete work
  • Designing and implementing web application pages using Angular, Typescript, CSS, HTML
  • Designing and implementing web API’s using .Net Core, C#, SQL Server
  • To work well within a team environment
  • To abide by design and coding guidelines
  • To be proactive and self-sufficient with excellent attention to detail
Essential Technical Skills
  • 3+ Years commercial web development
  • High level of HTML, CSS, JavaScript
  • Good experience of Typescript
  • Experience of Angular or another front end framework
  • High level of C#, .Net Web API
  • Git or similar source control system

Desirable Technical Skills
  • Microsoft Team Services/TFS
  • NgRX and/or client-side state management
  • SQL Server/TSQL/Azure SQL
  • Entity Framework
  • Telerik Kendo UI

title: Software Engineer
description:
Cordius are currently looking for a skilled developer to join the UK's largest tachograph analysis provider.
As a member of the software development team, you will be focusing on the server-side data processing aspect of the solution. As a provider of tachograph analysis, the solution relies on the constant and efficient processing of large amounts of data, and we are seeking someone to assume responsibility for this area, implement new features, and suggest improvements. The role requires gaining knowledge of the business domain in order to contribute to the analysis of features and, as needed, to the overall software design.
Technology Description
The solution comprises multiple C# .Net Core services running in a Kubernetes environment.
Data is stored in a Mongo DB database.
Several other Azure services are used including Service Bus and Storage accounts
Deployment of services is automated via DevOps and the environment via Helm
Processed data is made available to other areas of the solution via .Net Core Web APIs
Unit tests and other automated integration tests are in place
Key Responsibilities
  • Deliver high quality software in acceptable timescales
  • To take ownership of a significant and key area within the solution
  • To suggest estimates of expected time to complete work
  • Designing and implementing services using C#, .Net Core, Azure, MongoDB
  • Designing and implementing web API’s using .Net Core, C#
  • To work well within a team environment
  • To abide by design and coding guidelines
  • To be proactive and self-sufficient with excellent attention to detail
Essential Technical Skills
  • 3+ Years commercial C# development (where development had been predominantly in C# rather than other technologies)
  • A good understanding of best practices with regards to software design

Desirable Technical Skills
  • MongoDB
  • Kubernetes/Helm
  • Azure Service Bus and/or other Azure services
  • DevOps pipelines

title: Front End Developer
description:
Green Shoots Recruitment Ltd is looking for a passionate, seasoned and devoted Senior Front End Developer who is excited by the art of the possible within web with excellent skills to join the talented team of designers across multiple disciplines. You’ll be ambitious, keen to work collaboratively with a team of creatives and committed to developing your skillset and the teams around you.

As a Senior Front End Developer, you would be responsible for delivering creative for clients and internal audiences. Your involvement is critical in all phases of the web design process, particularly concept development, production and product development. You will work closely alongside our existing designers, Technical Lead and Project Managers assisting them in innovating, leading and managing, our web development offerings.

As Senior Front End Developer, with a number of years’ experience, you will be required to showcase a strong portfolio of website design and development work in order to be considered for this role. Please provide a link to your portfolio or relevant work you have produced.

Senior Front End Developer Responsibilities include:

  • Design/Creative Responsibilities

  • Working closely with the creatives to design and build compelling, high-quality websites and immersive experiences

  • Meticulous QA and review of final output before presenting to the Creative Lead for client send-off

  • Managing and leading projects from brief to delivery, delegating where necessary whilst ensuring the Creative Lead/Project Lead is kept informed of the status of projects

  • Utilising conceptual and design skills to bring ideas to life and define an artistic direction

  • Shaping the details of projects by providing cutting-edge techniques and technologie

Interpersonal Responsibilities

  • Working with the wider team to innovate the web department

  • Confidently pitching ideas to clients during calls/workshops

  • Defining timescales and project milestones

  • Being involved in and potentially leading ideation sessions with the rest of the team.

  • Training team members in production best practices to support collaboration

General Responsibilities

  • Managing deadlines and ensuring projects are delivered on time

  • Being observant of the needs and behaviours of staff members both within the web team and the broader company

  • Staying current with production tools and technological advancement.

The successful Senior Front End Developer must be proficient with:

  • HTML5, SCSS, JavaScript (ES6)

  • Modern Javascript framework of your choice (React/Vue) – not essential but desirable

  • WebGL competency (Three.js) – not essential but desirable

  • Competency with CSS frameworks such as Bootstrap

  • Familiarity with WordPress

  • CSS methodologies such as BEM

  • Version control (Git)

  • Build tools/package managers such as Webpack

  • Understanding of web accessibility (WCAG 2.1)

  • Ability to comfortably manage, maintain and deploy websites across various hosting providers.

  • Familiarity with the entire web development lifecycle (UX -> Deployment)

  • Comfortable working with designers/project managers and the wider team

  • Excellent communication skills

  • Act as a consultant to direct how we approach the development stage of projects

Desirable skills for the Senior Front End Developer

  • UX/UI experience

  • Ability and confidence to be involved in the design stage (Adobe / Figma)

  • Familiarity and experience of SEO

  • PHP / WordPress development (ACF)

  • Experience in working with Jamstack

Benefits:

  • Flexible working hours

  • Remote working

  • Competitive salary and opportunities for business trips

  • Paid overtime

  • The option to convert overtime into ‘owed time’ or into extra holiday entitlement

  • Tailored packages to each employee’s wants or needs

  • Unlimited career progression and freedom to shape your role

  • Inspire afternoons and outings, including regular staff parties!

  • Free fruit and unlimited beverages

  • High-spec equipment

  • Monthly prizes and weekly opportunities for a lie-in

  • Comfy communal area and breakout spaces

Don’t forget to send links to your portfolio of Website design and development showcasing your very best work alongside your CV.

title: Platform Engineer
description:
About Us

We're an award-winning innovative tech consultancy - a team of creative problem solvers. Since 1993 we've been finding better, more sustainable ways to solve complex technology problems for some of the world's leading organisations and delivered solutions that millions of people use every day.

In the last 30 years we won several awards, including a prestigious Queen's Award for Enterprise in the Innovation category for our Enterprise Agile delivery approach.

Operating from 26 locations across the world, we bring together teams of creative experts with diverse backgrounds and experiences, who enjoy working and learning in our collaborative and open culture and are committed to world-class delivery.

We want to continue to grow our team with people just like you!

Our platform engineers design, build and maintain the delivery infrastructure, systems and processes underpinning technology transformation engagements and lead the adoption of modern platforms and ways of working.

About the Role

We're looking for hands-on platform engineers with deep understanding of the Azure ecosystem to join delivery teams working on some of the most exciting digital programmes around, with clients in a range of industries.

As an Azure expert, you'll work in small product teams alongside developers, architects, designers, analysts and product owners to deliver automation, tooling and cloud infrastructure.

We encourage continuous learning, so as well as the opportunity to work with some of the brightest and best in the industry, and evaluate the latest technologies, we'll reward you for obtaining Azure certifications.

About You

You'll have the expertise and confidence to lead the definition and support of the Azure delivery platform in complex engagements, typically working in multi-disciplinary teams on client site. You'll have:

  • Commercial experience across designing, deploying and managing cloud environments in Azure.
  • Experience of containers and container orchestration using Docker, Kubernetes, and AKS.
  • Experience with infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform, ARM Templates, Helm, or Pulumi.
  • Experience of pipeline build/deploy tools such as Azure DevOps, TFS, or Jenkins.
  • In-depth automation and scripting using tools such as PowerShell, AZ CLI, Python, Bash, Ruby, or Groovy.
  • Detailed knowledge of configuration management technologies like DSC, Puppet, Chef, SaltStack, or Ansible.
  • Thorough knowledge of logging and monitoring tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, Azure Monitor, Azure Log Analytics, Azure App Insights, New Relic, or Datadog.
  • Knowledge of cloud platform design patterns and best practices.
  • Knowledge of common database and caching technologies, such as Azure SQL, CosmosDB, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, MySQL/MariaDB, Memcache, or Redis.
  • Some knowledge of common programming languages used in modern web application development, such as C#, JavaScript, TypeScript, Java, Go, or PHP.
  • Exposure to iterative/agile development methodologies and experience of enabling team delivery through technology.
  • As a bonus, experience of other cloud platforms and technologies.

If you don't feel you match with all the above, we're still interested! We have opportunities across a wide range of skill sets and levels in tech. More than anything, we're excited about people who love technology and learning how to make it work. We'd really like to hear from you, and hopefully find you your dream job at BJSS.

Some of the Perks

  • Flexible benefits allowance – you choose how to spend your allowance (additional pension contributions, healthcare, dental and more)
  • Industry leading health and wellbeing plan - we partner with several wellbeing support functions to cater to each individual's need, including 24/7 GP services, mental health support, and other
  • Life Assurance (4 x annual salary)
  • 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
  • Hybrid working - Our roles are not fully remote as we take pride in the tight knit communities we have created at our local offices. But we offer plenty of flexibility and you can split your time between the office, client site and WFH
  • Discounts – we have preferred rates from dozens of retail, lifestyle, and utility brands
  • An industry-leading referral scheme with no limits on the number of referrals
  • Flexible holiday buy/sell option
  • Electric vehicle scheme
  • Training opportunities and incentives – we support professional certifications across engineering and non-engineering roles, including unlimited access to O'Reilly
  • Giving back – the ability to get involved nationally and regionally with partnerships to get people from diverse backgrounds into tech
  • You will become part of a squad with people from different areas within the business who will help you grow at BJSS
  • We have a busy social calendar that you can chose to join– quarterly town halls/squad nights out/weekends away with families included/office get togethers
  • GymFlex gym membership programme

title: Back End Developer
description:
Your attitude, potential and passion is what matters. Work inside a talented development team, you will be expected to produce well tested code to a tight acceptance criteria.

Viva IT is an innovative and exciting fintech. We specialise in creating mobile app and web-based financial software. Although we have a fully remote workforce, we are centred in the East Midlands, UK.

We believe there are just a few simple things needed to create great software: state of the art technology, a continuously delivering pipeline of code, a purpose, a relaxed working environment, and most importantly a like minded team of people.

We take an hybrid-agile approach to product development, forgoing the traditional vertical structure of management, meaning that even our newest developers will be given opportunities and encouraged to lead and learn.

We're looking for software engineers who share our passion for code. We're primarily a PHP team, but we're strong believers that language doesn't matter - the kind of software engineer we're looking for will be able to create magic, regardless of the language however previous experience in our tools will be a bonus.

We use an array of tools, technologies and frameworks including:

  • PHP 8.2
  • Symfony LTS releases including: 5.4 and 6.4
  • MySQL
  • React
  • Javascript
  • PHPUnit
  • Git & GitHub
  • YouTrack
  • TeamCity
  • PHPStorm

Exposure to these tools is always favourable, but as an engineer we're sure you'll relish the opportunity to learn new technology and use new tools. We release multiple times a day through a fully automated release pipeline, this is development in the fast lane and there is no room to dawdle.

Ultimately, we want people who have a compulsion to solve problems, that thrive at being challenged, crave knowledge, aspire to be the best, a desire to deliver value, and most of all, people who have a real passion for the work. People just like us.

Requirements

  • A BSc/MSc in a relevant field such as computer science, software engineering, etc.
  • or 2 years of relevant industry experience in commercial software development.

Our ideal candidate would have:

  • 2 years of commercial Programming experience, ideally in PHP.
  • Great understanding of object-oriented design and patterns.
  • First-hand experience in creating database driven applications.
  • Extensive experience in version control systems, particularly Git.
  • A good understanding of web application security.
  • A good understanding of software testing.
  • A passion for open-source technology.

What is the work like?

For an insight into what is like working as a software developer at Viva IT, take a look at some blogs from other developers:

  • A year with Viva IT by Sophie
  • A month with Viva IT by Joe
  • Four years with Viva IT by Kane
  • Things I wish I'd known before starting at Viva IT by Leighton

Salary

Starting salary is negotiated based on previous experience with annual reviews. However indicative bands are below, depending on relevant acedemic background and commercial experience.

  • Graduate without commercial experience (BSc Hons): £25k
  • Graduate with 2y commercial experience: £25k-35k
  • 2-4y relevant experience: £35k-48k
  • 5y+ relevant experience: £48k+

We consider all experience and acedemic achievements.

Remote Work

The COVID-19 lockdowns accelerated our plans to become a remote-first company. Our team has transitioned fully to fully remote and there are no plans to return to the office. We heavily use remote collaboration tools. Although the path to remote-first includes an international team and no restrictions on working times, we're not quite ready for this yet.

It is critical that:

  • You have a quiet and comfortable location where you can work from home, equipment can be provided.
  • You can travel occasionally (2-4 times a year) to a location in the East Midlands, UK.
  • You can work typical office times 09:00 to 17:30 (we've not transitioned to full flexible working)
  • Must be based in the UK permanently.

Visa/Sponsorships

We are not licensed to sponsor a visa and we have no immediate plans to register for a license.

Eligibility to work in the UK

Please ensure that you are eligible to work in the United Kingdom before you apply without a time limited visa.

Recruiters

We do not work with recruiters in any capacity. Please do not call us or send unsolicited CV's.

Location

Although we have a remote team, we do occasionally meet up for social or business critical kick-off meetings. It is important that you can occasionally travel to these venues which will be based around the East Midlands.

Job Directory Websites

If you came to this page via another recruitment website or job directory, please be advised that if you submit your information through this job directory channel, you might not get a response.

Applying

If you're interested, please send us anything you'd like us to take a look at such as your CV, cover letter, links to your personal website, portfolios or GitHub to careers@vivait.co.uk.

Grow with us. Help us to succeed, and we'll help you to succeed.

If you have a further enquiry that might not be answered on this page, or you would like to apply for a role on our careers page, it is crucial that you contact us via our email address. We will not be able to help via the telephone. Any messages sent to our careers email address will be picked up by a member of our team.

The ideal candidate will be an exceptionally talented Front-End / JavaScript Developer who is passionate about producing solutions of the highest possible standard and working on bleeding edge products with a team of likeminded peers.

  • Experience working with UX / Visual Designers implementing design specs with above tech stack
  • Experience with automated Web UI testing frameworks
  • Ability to be a design authority to less experienced developers and perform peer reviews

title: Software Engineer
description:
This is an exciting opportunity to join an award winning, well-established and growing software company, based in Nottingham City Centre. Providing pioneering technology, you’ll contribute to a range of innovative and high-profile projects. The role covers all aspects of software production, but the focus is on the development of web applications.


Technologies used include:


  • ASP.NET MVC with C# 6 & 7 (Web API, RESTful)
  • SQL Server 2016 (complex data transformations, high performance querying)
  • Reactive, modern designs (Bootstrap, SVG, Highcharts, D3.js)
  • Extensive JavaScript use (MVVM via Knockout.js, SPA via Durandal)
  • Distributed architecture (MassTransit, RabbitMQ)
  • .NET Core with Identity Server
  • Agile process (Scrum, CI, CD, Kanban, automated testing)


Requirements:


We’re looking for capable, highly literate and personable people with web application development experience with the Microsoft development stack, particularly C#, although other relevant skills and experience will be considered.


Just as importantly, we need you to be able to analyse problems, produce effective documentation and see projects through to fruition. We want you to use your skills and experience to help shape the direction of products you are working on.


In particular, the experience we’re looking for is in:


  • Implementing web applications using MVC/MVVM patterns
  • MS SQL Server, including optimised stored procedures, performance analysis, optimisation and tuning
  • JavaScript frameworks, particularly Knockout.js
  • Rich Single Page Application-style user interfaces


Any of the following experience would be beneficial:


  • High Availability (HA) & Disaster Recovery (DR)
  • Statistical calculations and modelling
  • Developing software for healthcare


Remuneration and Benefits:


  • £35,000 - £45,000 + Benefits
  • Friendly, relaxed environment
  • Flexible working conditions
  • Ongoing professional development and training tailored to you


Location:


Nottingham City Centre


If you think you’ve got what it takes, we’d love to hear from you!

title: .NET Developer
description:
We are looking for an experienced Microsoft C# .NET Developer to work in a small team working on exciting software projects. You will work alongside the Architect/Lead Developer to deliver creative business solutions. You must be able to contribute to the team effort in Leicester and also be capable of working with minimal supervision where required and offer some support to junior staff. Occasional direct interaction with customers may be necessary.

You must also be able to work and develop with Microsoft Technologies through .NET (Remoting, ASP.NET, ADO.NET, MVC), XAML, WCF, .NET Framework, Windows Processes & Threads, TCP/IP, RPC, Entity Framework, LINQ

They are open and forward looking and encourage participation, input and new creative ideas from all staff. Working with their Development Director you will be expected to get up to speed quickly and then capable of working with minimum supervision.

Location: Leicester (city centre)

Salary: £35,000 - £45,000 + Travel/Parking/Meals allowance

description:

Just as importantly, you will need to be able to analyse problems, produce effective documentation and see projects through to fruition. They will want you to use your skills and experience to help shape the direction of products you are working on.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Our talented people are creating the technology of the future.

Tracsis’ purpose is to empower the world to move freely, safely and sustainably. Our approach focuses on combining leading edge software and hardware knowledge, data capture, analytics and industry expertise to generate insights and fast-to-market products and services.

MPEC Technology, who are part of the Tracsis group, is the leading supplier of condition monitoring hardware and software to the UK railway and has helped make Britain’s railways safer and more reliable. We get to work with technology as old as mechanical signalling, right through to the latest artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms.

What you will do..

You will be joining our growing team of enterprise software engineers to deliver the Centrix web application which receives, analyses and presents data from our IOT devices. This platform processes billions of data events from across the UK and worldwide; providing near real-time monitoring and fault alerting for a variety of railway assets.

As a member of the enterprise development team, you will be responsible for designing and implementing new features, collaborating as part of an agile team.

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or similar field.
  • Excellent (English) written and verbal communication skills.
  • Object-Oriented Development e.g. JAVA.

Desirable Skills. You don't need to tick every box!

  • Knowledge of Relational Databases, e.g. SQL.
  • Familiarity with Spring Framework and/or Spring Boot.
  • Web concepts such as HTTP, REST, JSON.
  • Experience with frontend development
  • Frontend stack e.g. HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
  • Frontend JavaScript framework(s) e.g. Angular, React etc.
  • Understanding of version control systems e.g. Git.

Tech Stack

  • Java
  • Spring Boot Framework
  • SQL / relational database
  • Hibernate
  • Typescript / Javascript
  • AngularJS Framework
  • HTML + CSS / LESS
  • Git
  • AWS
  • CI/CD Tools

What we will offer you..

  • Flexible working hours
  • Hybrid/ remote working options
  • Generous group bonus scheme.
  • 25 days leave, plus bank holidays (extendable through long term service scheme).
  • Discounted commuter rail travel.
  • Discounted leisure rail travel for you and a partner.
  • Complimentary lunch provided every day (when working in the office)
  • Company cycle scheme.
  • BUPA medical health care from day 1


We are a 2024 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

title: Developer
description:

title: Front End Developer
description:

The role requires gaining knowledge of the business domain in order to contribute to the analysis of features and, as needed, to the overall software design.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Cordius are currently looking for a skilled developer to join the UK's largest tachograph analysis provider.
As a member of the software development team, you will be focusing on the server-side data processing aspect of the solution. As a provider of tachograph analysis, the solution relies on the constant and efficient processing of large amounts of data, and we are seeking someone to assume responsibility for this area, implement new features, and suggest improvements. The role requires gaining knowledge of the business domain in order to contribute to the analysis of features and, as needed, to the overall software design.
Technology Description
The solution comprises multiple C# .Net Core services running in a Kubernetes environment.
Data is stored in a Mongo DB database.
Several other Azure services are used including Service Bus and Storage accounts
Deployment of services is automated via DevOps and the environment via Helm
Processed data is made available to other areas of the solution via .Net Core Web APIs
Unit tests and other automated integration tests are in place
Key Responsibilities
  • Deliver high quality software in acceptable timescales
  • To take ownership of a significant and key area within the solution
  • To suggest estimates of expected time to complete work
  • Designing and implementing services using C#, .Net Core, Azure, MongoDB
  • Designing and implementing web API’s using .Net Core, C#
  • To work well within a team environment
  • To abide by design and coding guidelines
  • To be proactive and self-sufficient with excellent attention to detail
Essential Technical Skills
  • 3+ Years commercial C# development (where development had been predominantly in C# rather than other technologies)
  • A good understanding of best practices with regards to software design

Desirable Technical Skills
  • MongoDB
  • Kubernetes/Helm
  • Azure Service Bus and/or other Azure services
  • DevOps pipelines

title: Front End Developer
description:
Green Shoots Recruitment Ltd is looking for a passionate, seasoned and devoted Senior Front End Developer who is excited by the art of the possible within web with excellent skills to join the talented team of designers across multiple disciplines. You’ll be ambitious, keen to work collaboratively with a team of creatives and committed to developing your skillset and the teams around you.

As a Senior Front End Developer, you would be responsible for delivering creative for clients and internal audiences. Your involvement is critical in all phases of the web design process, particularly concept development, production and product development. You will work closely alongside our existing designers, Technical Lead and Project Managers assisting them in innovating, leading and managing, our web development offerings.

As Senior Front End Developer, with a number of years’ experience, you will be required to showcase a strong portfolio of website design and development work in order to be considered for this role. Please provide a link to your portfolio or relevant work you have produced.

Senior Front End Developer Responsibilities include:

  • Design/Creative Responsibilities

  • Working closely with the creatives to design and build compelling, high-quality websites and immersive experiences

  • Meticulous QA and review of final output before presenting to the Creative Lead for client send-off

  • Managing and leading projects from brief to delivery, delegating where necessary whilst ensuring the Creative Lead/Project Lead is kept informed of the status of projects

  • Utilising conceptual and design skills to bring ideas to life and define an artistic direction

  • Shaping the details of projects by providing cutting-edge techniques and technologie

Interpersonal Responsibilities

  • Working with the wider team to innovate the web department

  • Confidently pitching ideas to clients during calls/workshops

  • Defining timescales and project milestones

  • Being involved in and potentially leading ideation sessions with the rest of the team.

  • Training team members in production best practices to support collaboration

General Responsibilities

  • Managing deadlines and ensuring projects are delivered on time

  • Being observant of the needs and behaviours of staff members both within the web team and the broader company

  • Staying current with production tools and technological advancement.

The successful Senior Front End Developer must be proficient with:

  • HTML5, SCSS, JavaScript (ES6)

  • Modern Javascript framework of your choice (React/Vue) – not essential but desirable

  • WebGL competency (Three.js) – not essential but desirable

  • Competency with CSS frameworks such as Bootstrap

  • Familiarity with WordPress

  • CSS methodologies such as BEM

  • Version control (Git)

  • Build tools/package managers such as Webpack

  • Understanding of web accessibility (WCAG 2.1)

  • Ability to comfortably manage, maintain and deploy websites across various hosting providers.

  • Familiarity with the entire web development lifecycle (UX -> Deployment)

  • Comfortable working with designers/project managers and the wider team

  • Excellent communication skills

  • Act as a consultant to direct how we approach the development stage of projects

Desirable skills for the Senior Front End Developer

  • UX/UI experience

  • Ability and confidence to be involved in the design stage (Adobe / Figma)

  • Familiarity and experience of SEO

  • PHP / WordPress development (ACF)

  • Experience in working with Jamstack

Benefits:

  • Flexible working hours

  • Remote working

  • Competitive salary and opportunities for business trips

  • Paid overtime

  • The option to convert overtime into ‘owed time’ or into extra holiday entitlement

  • Tailored packages to each employee’s wants or needs

  • Unlimited career progression and freedom to shape your role

  • Inspire afternoons and outings, including regular staff parties!

  • Free fruit and unlimited beverages

  • High-spec equipment

  • Monthly prizes and weekly opportunities for a lie-in

  • Comfy communal area and breakout spaces

Don’t forget to send links to your portfolio of Website design and development showcasing your very best work alongside your CV.

title: Platform Engineer
description:
About Us

We're an award-winning innovative tech consultancy - a team of creative problem solvers. Since 1993 we've been finding better, more sustainable ways to solve complex technology problems for some of the world's leading organisations and delivered solutions that millions of people use every day.

In the last 30 years we won several awards, including a prestigious Queen's Award for Enterprise in the Innovation category for our Enterprise Agile delivery approach.

Operating from 26 locations across the world, we bring together teams of creative experts with diverse backgrounds and experiences, who enjoy working and learning in our collaborative and open culture and are committed to world-class delivery.

We want to continue to grow our team with people just like you!

Our platform engineers design, build and maintain the delivery infrastructure, systems and processes underpinning technology transformation engagements and lead the adoption of modern platforms and ways of working.

About the Role

We're looking for hands-on platform engineers with deep understanding of the Azure ecosystem to join delivery teams working on some of the most exciting digital programmes around, with clients in a range of industries.

As an Azure expert, you'll work in small product teams alongside developers, architects, designers, analysts and product owners to deliver automation, tooling and cloud infrastructure.

We encourage continuous learning, so as well as the opportunity to work with some of the brightest and best in the industry, and evaluate the latest technologies, we'll reward you for obtaining Azure certifications.

About You

You'll have the expertise and confidence to lead the definition and support of the Azure delivery platform in complex engagements, typically working in multi-disciplinary teams on client site. You'll have:

  • Commercial experience across designing, deploying and managing cloud environments in Azure.
  • Experience of containers and container orchestration using Docker, Kubernetes, and AKS.
  • Experience with infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform, ARM Templates, Helm, or Pulumi.
  • Experience of pipeline build/deploy tools such as Azure DevOps, TFS, or Jenkins.
  • In-depth automation and scripting using tools such as PowerShell, AZ CLI, Python, Bash, Ruby, or Groovy.
  • Detailed knowledge of configuration management technologies like DSC, Puppet, Chef, SaltStack, or Ansible.
  • Thorough knowledge of logging and monitoring tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, Azure Monitor, Azure Log Analytics, Azure App Insights, New Relic, or Datadog.
  • Knowledge of cloud platform design patterns and best practices.
  • Knowledge of common database and caching technologies, such as Azure SQL, CosmosDB, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, MySQL/MariaDB, Memcache, or Redis.
  • Some knowledge of common programming languages used in modern web application development, such as C#, JavaScript, TypeScript, Java, Go, or PHP.
  • Exposure to iterative/agile development methodologies and experience of enabling team delivery through technology.
  • As a bonus, experience of other cloud platforms and technologies.

If you don't feel you match with all the above, we're still interested! We have opportunities across a wide range of skill sets and levels in tech. More than anything, we're excited about people who love technology and learning how to make it work. We'd really like to hear from you, and hopefully find you your dream job at BJSS.

Some of the Perks

  • Flexible benefits allowance – you choose how to spend your allowance (additional pension contributions, healthcare, dental and more)
  • Industry leading health and wellbeing plan - we partner with several wellbeing support functions to cater to each individual's need, including 24/7 GP services, mental health support, and other
  • Life Assurance (4 x annual salary)
  • 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
  • Hybrid working - Our roles are not fully remote as we take pride in the tight knit communities we have created at our local offices. But we offer plenty of flexibility and you can split your time between the office, client site and WFH
  • Discounts – we have preferred rates from dozens of retail, lifestyle, and utility brands
  • An industry-leading referral scheme with no limits on the number of referrals
  • Flexible holiday buy/sell option
  • Electric vehicle scheme
  • Training opportunities and incentives – we support professional certifications across engineering and non-engineering roles, including unlimited access to O'Reilly
  • Giving back – the ability to get involved nationally and regionally with partnerships to get people from diverse backgrounds into tech
  • You will become part of a squad with people from different areas within the business who will help you grow at BJSS
  • We have a busy social calendar that you can chose to join– quarterly town halls/squad nights out/weekends away with families included/office get togethers
  • GymFlex gym membership programme

title: Back End Developer
description:
Your attitude, potential and passion is what matters. Work inside a talented development team, you will be expected to produce well tested code to a tight acceptance criteria.

Viva IT is an innovative and exciting fintech. We specialise in creating mobile app and web-based financial software. Although we have a fully remote workforce, we are centred in the East Midlands, UK.

We believe there are just a few simple things needed to create great software: state of the art technology, a continuously delivering pipeline of code, a purpose, a relaxed working environment, and most importantly a like minded team of people.

We take an hybrid-agile approach to product development, forgoing the traditional vertical structure of management, meaning that even our newest developers will be given opportunities and encouraged to lead and learn.

We're looking for software engineers who share our passion for code. We're primarily a PHP team, but we're strong believers that language doesn't matter - the kind of software engineer we're looking for will be able to create magic, regardless of the language however previous experience in our tools will be a bonus.

We use an array of tools, technologies and frameworks including:

  • PHP 8.2
  • Symfony LTS releases including: 5.4 and 6.4
  • MySQL
  • React
  • Javascript
  • PHPUnit
  • Git & GitHub
  • YouTrack
  • TeamCity
  • PHPStorm

Exposure to these tools is always favourable, but as an engineer we're sure you'll relish the opportunity to learn new technology and use new tools. We release multiple times a day through a fully automated release pipeline, this is development in the fast lane and there is no room to dawdle.

Ultimately, we want people who have a compulsion to solve problems, that thrive at being challenged, crave knowledge, aspire to be the best, a desire to deliver value, and most of all, people who have a real passion for the work. People just like us.

Requirements

  • A BSc/MSc in a relevant field such as computer science, software engineering, etc.
  • or 2 years of relevant industry experience in commercial software development.

Our ideal candidate would have:

  • 2 years of commercial Programming experience, ideally in PHP.
  • Great understanding of object-oriented design and patterns.
  • First-hand experience in creating database driven applications.
  • Extensive experience in version control systems, particularly Git.
  • A good understanding of web application security.
  • A good understanding of software testing.
  • A passion for open-source technology.

What is the work like?

For an insight into what is like working as a software developer at Viva IT, take a look at some blogs from other developers:

  • A year with Viva IT by Sophie
  • A month with Viva IT by Joe
  • Four years with Viva IT by Kane
  • Things I wish I'd known before starting at Viva IT by Leighton

Salary

Starting salary is negotiated based on previous experience with annual reviews. However indicative bands are below, depending on relevant acedemic background and commercial experience.

  • Graduate without commercial experience (BSc Hons): £25k
  • Graduate with 2y commercial experience: £25k-35k
  • 2-4y relevant experience: £35k-48k
  • 5y+ relevant experience: £48k+

We consider all experience and acedemic achievements.

Remote Work

The COVID-19 lockdowns accelerated our plans to become a remote-first company. Our team has transitioned fully to fully remote and there are no plans to return to the office. We heavily use remote collaboration tools. Although the path to remote-first includes an international team and no restrictions on working times, we're not quite ready for this yet.

It is critical that:

  • You have a quiet and comfortable location where you can work from home, equipment can be provided.
  • You can travel occasionally (2-4 times a year) to a location in the East Midlands, UK.
  • You can work typical office times 09:00 to 17:30 (we've not transitioned to full flexible working)
  • Must be based in the UK permanently.

Visa/Sponsorships

We are not licensed to sponsor a visa and we have no immediate plans to register for a license.

Eligibility to work in the UK

Please ensure that you are eligible to work in the United Kingdom before you apply without a time limited visa.

Recruiters

We do not work with recruiters in any capacity. Please do not call us or send unsolicited CV's.

Location

Although we have a remote team, we do occasionally meet up for social or business critical kick-off meetings. It is important that you can occasionally travel to these venues which will be based around the East Midlands.

Job Directory Websites

If you came to this page via another recruitment website or job directory, please be advised that if you submit your information through this job directory channel, you might not get a response.

Applying

If you're interested, please send us anything you'd like us to take a look at such as your CV, cover letter, links to your personal website, portfolios or GitHub to careers@vivait.co.uk.

Grow with us. Help us to succeed, and we'll help you to succeed.

If you have a further enquiry that might not be answered on this page, or you would like to apply for a role on our careers page, it is crucial that you contact us via our email address. We will not be able to help via the telephone. Any messages sent to our careers email address will be picked up by a member of our team.

  • No dress code and free coffee and pizza
  • Employee offers and discounts
  • Heavy focus on career progression


Our client is looking to find the right person as soon as possible, so if you feel you are suited and interested in the position, please click Apply Now and send us your CV directly.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Our talented people are creating the technology of the future.

Tracsis’ purpose is to empower the world to move freely, safely and sustainably. Our approach focuses on combining leading edge software and hardware knowledge, data capture, analytics and industry expertise to generate insights and fast-to-market products and services.

MPEC Technology, who are part of the Tracsis group, is the leading supplier of condition monitoring hardware and software to the UK railway and has helped make Britain’s railways safer and more reliable. We get to work with technology as old as mechanical signalling, right through to the latest artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms.

What you will do..

You will be joining our growing team of enterprise software engineers to deliver the Centrix web application which receives, analyses and presents data from our IOT devices. This platform processes billions of data events from across the UK and worldwide; providing near real-time monitoring and fault alerting for a variety of railway assets.

As a member of the enterprise development team, you will be responsible for designing and implementing new features, collaborating as part of an agile team.

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or similar field.
  • Excellent (English) written and verbal communication skills.
  • Object-Oriented Development e.g. JAVA.

Desirable Skills. You don't need to tick every box!

  • Knowledge of Relational Databases, e.g. SQL.
  • Familiarity with Spring Framework and/or Spring Boot.
  • Web concepts such as HTTP, REST, JSON.
  • Experience with frontend development
  • Frontend stack e.g. HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
  • Frontend JavaScript framework(s) e.g. Angular, React etc.
  • Understanding of version control systems e.g. Git.

Tech Stack

  • Java
  • Spring Boot Framework
  • SQL / relational database
  • Hibernate
  • Typescript / Javascript
  • AngularJS Framework
  • HTML + CSS / LESS
  • Git
  • AWS
  • CI/CD Tools

What we will offer you..

  • Flexible working hours
  • Hybrid/ remote working options
  • Generous group bonus scheme.
  • 25 days leave, plus bank holidays (extendable through long term service scheme).
  • Discounted commuter rail travel.
  • Discounted leisure rail travel for you and a partner.
  • Complimentary lunch provided every day (when working in the office)
  • Company cycle scheme.
  • BUPA medical health care from day 1


We are a 2024 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

title: Senior Developer
description:
Job Title: Senior C# Developer, Web Applications

My client, an esteemed innovator in the hospitality technology sector, is on the hunt for a proficient Senior C# Developer. This exciting opportunity based in Derby involves the creation of high-performing web applications, interfaces, and APIs.

This is a fantastic opportunity for a candidate who thrives in a team-oriented environment, is driven by producing quality work, and has a proven track record in C# development. The ideal candidate will be excited about the complexities and rewards that come with crafting solutions from high-level user requirements and liaising with other team members.

Key responsibilities and requirements:
  • Exceptional C# development proficiency and comprehensive understanding of its fundamental principles.
  • Advanced T-SQL skills.
  • A minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience with .net Frameworks.
  • Sound understanding of object-oriented programming.
  • Experience with Visual Studio.
  • Proficient understanding of REST APIs.
  • Track record of full application development lifecycle.
  • Eagerness to acquire new development skills and stay abreast of the latest technologies.

Bonus qualifications (but not mandatory):
  • Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS).
  • Experience with Git source control.
  • Our client encourages self-motivation, enjoys the thrill of tackling challenges, and savours the independence that comes with designing solutions.

What you can expect…

My client firmly believes that a happy workplace yields fantastic outcomes. Hence, they invest in their people, offering:
  • Unparalleled training and development opportunities.
  • A relaxed dress code, promoting casual comfort.
  • Regular social events to foster team cohesion.

Don't miss out on this fantastic opportunity to join a collaborative and dynamic team. Ignite your passion for technology while working on exciting projects and develop your career with an industry leader. Apply now!

title: Developer
description:
Support Developer

Salary: Up to £30,000 DOE

The Role:

We are looking for a talented Web Developer to join our growing support team. Working in a collaborative
and creative environment, this role involves working with a wide range of clients, from well-known brands
to exciting startups.

Absolute has been established for 25 years. We're a digital creative agency and Magento Business
Solution Partner, specialising in Magento ecommerce, with an impressive and varied client base. We are
looking for an experienced and talented Web Developer to join our growing team.

You’ll work on challenging and varied projects from Magento ecommerce to CMS sites, across a range of
clients. As a talented and enthusiastic Web Developer you’ll be passionate about progressing your
development knowledge and working towards a certification in M2, for which we provide study aids and
mentoring.

Essential skills

  • Strong HTML, CSS and JS
  • Good working knowledge of PHP and MySQL
  • Experience with at least one PHP based CMS, e.g Concrete5 / ExpressionEngine
  • Experience of version control, preferably Git
  • Experience working in a process-driven environment
  • Strong communication skills
  • An appetite for personal learning and development.

Desirable skills

  • Magento experience - 1+ year
  • Experience of CSS preprocessors (SASS / LESS)
  • Framework knowledge eg jQuery, AngularJS
  • A good understanding of Linux-based hosting environments
  • A working understanding of internet architecture
  • An interest in the state and shape of the web industry.

Key responsibilities

  • Collaborating with members of the team
  • Helping us in shaping our solutions and process
  • Interpreting requirement briefs, specifications, wireframes and designs
  • Realising designs in HTML/CSS/Javascript
  • Occasionally developing web applications using new technologies such as Angular
  • Problem solving minor issues on existing sites.

Applicants should send a full CV to jobs@absolute-design.co.uk with details of previous online experience.

title: Front End Developer
description:

We are seeking an individual who is confident, positive and will take a proactive approach to their work and learning.

We need a motivated developer that is comfortable communicating with customers and team members at all levels when required. We need you to work to a high standard at all times using the latest development methods and techniques whilst ensuring that deadlines are met and excelled. We pay very competitive salaries, in addition to a wide range of benefits such as holiday incentives, financial bonuses, fun days and nights out and a place to work where you can have fun.

The culture here at Fifteen offers a friendly and welcoming place to work, where we have a mutual respect for each other. We listen and care about each other. You can have fun with our table tennis and arcade game.

HOW TO APPLY

Send an email to careers@fifteen.co.uk including your CV along with a covering letter stating why you’d be good for the role. Strictly no agencies.

title: PHP Developer
description:

If you have excellent programming skills and a passion for developing applications or improving existing ones, we would like to meet you.

HOURS AND ENVIRONMENT:

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Senior Java/JEE Developer
Responsibilities & Deliverables:

messaging.

What will work well with our team?
  • We take a pragmatic approach to our work in an environment that blends fun with professionalism.

  • Comfortable working under pressure to firm deadlines in an agile and lean way.

Wildfly/EAP 7, Tomcat) or similar app servers.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Cordius are currently looking for a skilled developer to join the UK's largest tachograph analysis provider.
As a member of the software development team, you will be focusing on the server-side data processing aspect of the solution. As a provider of tachograph analysis, the solution relies on the constant and efficient processing of large amounts of data, and we are seeking someone to assume responsibility for this area, implement new features, and suggest improvements. The role requires gaining knowledge of the business domain in order to contribute to the analysis of features and, as needed, to the overall software design.
Technology Description
The solution comprises multiple C# .Net Core services running in a Kubernetes environment.
Data is stored in a Mongo DB database.
Several other Azure services are used including Service Bus and Storage accounts
Deployment of services is automated via DevOps and the environment via Helm
Processed data is made available to other areas of the solution via .Net Core Web APIs
Unit tests and other automated integration tests are in place
Key Responsibilities
  • Deliver high quality software in acceptable timescales
  • To take ownership of a significant and key area within the solution
  • To suggest estimates of expected time to complete work
  • Designing and implementing services using C#, .Net Core, Azure, MongoDB
  • Designing and implementing web API’s using .Net Core, C#
  • To work well within a team environment
  • To abide by design and coding guidelines
  • To be proactive and self-sufficient with excellent attention to detail
Essential Technical Skills
  • 3+ Years commercial C# development (where development had been predominantly in C# rather than other technologies)
  • A good understanding of best practices with regards to software design

Desirable Technical Skills
  • MongoDB
  • Kubernetes/Helm
  • Azure Service Bus and/or other Azure services
  • DevOps pipelines

  • 3+ Years commercial web development

  • High level of C#, .Net Web API
  • Git or similar source control system

title: Front End Developer
description:
Green Shoots Recruitment Ltd is looking for a passionate, seasoned and devoted Senior Front End Developer who is excited by the art of the possible within web with excellent skills to join the talented team of designers across multiple disciplines. You’ll be ambitious, keen to work collaboratively with a team of creatives and committed to developing your skillset and the teams around you.

As a Senior Front End Developer, you would be responsible for delivering creative for clients and internal audiences. Your involvement is critical in all phases of the web design process, particularly concept development, production and product development. You will work closely alongside our existing designers, Technical Lead and Project Managers assisting them in innovating, leading and managing, our web development offerings.

As Senior Front End Developer, with a number of years’ experience, you will be required to showcase a strong portfolio of website design and development work in order to be considered for this role. Please provide a link to your portfolio or relevant work you have produced.

Senior Front End Developer Responsibilities include:

  • Design/Creative Responsibilities

  • Working closely with the creatives to design and build compelling, high-quality websites and immersive experiences

  • Meticulous QA and review of final output before presenting to the Creative Lead for client send-off

  • Managing and leading projects from brief to delivery, delegating where necessary whilst ensuring the Creative Lead/Project Lead is kept informed of the status of projects

  • Utilising conceptual and design skills to bring ideas to life and define an artistic direction

  • Shaping the details of projects by providing cutting-edge techniques and technologie

Interpersonal Responsibilities

  • Working with the wider team to innovate the web department

  • Confidently pitching ideas to clients during calls/workshops

  • Defining timescales and project milestones

  • Being involved in and potentially leading ideation sessions with the rest of the team.

  • Training team members in production best practices to support collaboration

General Responsibilities

  • Managing deadlines and ensuring projects are delivered on time

  • Being observant of the needs and behaviours of staff members both within the web team and the broader company

  • Staying current with production tools and technological advancement.

The successful Senior Front End Developer must be proficient with:

  • HTML5, SCSS, JavaScript (ES6)

  • Modern Javascript framework of your choice (React/Vue) – not essential but desirable

  • WebGL competency (Three.js) – not essential but desirable

  • Competency with CSS frameworks such as Bootstrap

  • Familiarity with WordPress

  • CSS methodologies such as BEM

  • Version control (Git)

  • Build tools/package managers such as Webpack

  • Understanding of web accessibility (WCAG 2.1)

  • Ability to comfortably manage, maintain and deploy websites across various hosting providers.

  • Familiarity with the entire web development lifecycle (UX -> Deployment)

  • Comfortable working with designers/project managers and the wider team

  • Excellent communication skills

  • Act as a consultant to direct how we approach the development stage of projects

Desirable skills for the Senior Front End Developer

  • UX/UI experience

  • Ability and confidence to be involved in the design stage (Adobe / Figma)

  • Familiarity and experience of SEO

  • PHP / WordPress development (ACF)

  • Experience in working with Jamstack

Benefits:

  • Flexible working hours

  • Remote working

  • Competitive salary and opportunities for business trips

  • Paid overtime

  • The option to convert overtime into ‘owed time’ or into extra holiday entitlement

  • Tailored packages to each employee’s wants or needs

  • Unlimited career progression and freedom to shape your role

  • Inspire afternoons and outings, including regular staff parties!

  • Free fruit and unlimited beverages

  • High-spec equipment

  • Monthly prizes and weekly opportunities for a lie-in

  • Comfy communal area and breakout spaces

Don’t forget to send links to your portfolio of Website design and development showcasing your very best work alongside your CV.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:

Location: Tamworth, Staffordshire, B79 7JT
